title: Evolutionarily Distinct and Globally Endangered calculator
text: EDGE index metric aims prioritize species’ conservation bsed theis phylogenetic singularity (.e. ED, Evolutionaty Distinctiveness) extinction risk (GE, Globally Endangered). Based idea, several methods developed order calculate individual EDGE scores. illustrate differences among methods ant implementationn within rEDGE package, see examples using monotremates (.e. platypus echidna species).

title: Evolutionarily Distinct and Globally Endangered calculator
text: Index based Isaac et al., 2007. first approach used evolutionary distinctiveness (ED) transformation extinction risk (GE) IUCN Red List category twice probable becoming extinct. EDGE score calculated ussing following formula: EDGE = log(1+ED)+GE∗log(2) calculate index monotremates, just use calculate_EDGE1 function specifying uot phylogenetic tree, table including tree’s species (clomn named species, respective IUCN category column named RL.cat). Note species must included, species included tree evaluated, make sure include table wit “NE” category.
code: EDGE1 <- calculate_EDGE1(tree = monotreme.tree,                           table = monotreme.table,                           sort.list = T # to get the list sorted by decreasing EDGE value                          )  knitr::kable(EDGE1)

title: Evolutionarily Distinct and Globally Endangered calculator
text: order take account extinction probability closely related taxa well uncertainty extinction probability species, Gumbs et al., 2023 designed new methodology, termed EDGE2. new approach, probabilty extinction sampled continuous distribution based IUCN Red List category, ED2 EDGE” values can calculated (develop thoroughly…). EDGE score iteration dependant (.e. random factor sampling extinction probabilty), set EDGE2 values can calculated averaged posteriorly. multiple calculation performed calculate_EDGE2_multiple function, allows parallelize order speed computation times. example calculating EDGE scores 50 times averaging results .
code: EDGE2 <- calculate_EDGE2(tree = monotreme.tree,                           table = monotreme.table,                           sort.list = T, # to get the list sorted by decreasing EDGE value                          verbose = F)  knitr::kable(EDGE2) EDGE2mult <- calculate_EDGE2_multiple(tree = monotreme.tree,                                        table = monotreme.table,                                        n.iter = 50,                                       parallelize = TRUE,                                       n.cores = 10                                       ) #> [1] "Seed has been set to: 39380337"   # Now we summarise table results... EDGE2mult_summ <- EDGE2mult |>    bind_rows()  |>    group_by(species) |>    summarise(RL.cat = paste0(unique(RL.cat)),             TBL  = mean(TBL ),             pext = mean(pext),             ED   = mean(ED  ),             EDGE = mean(EDGE) ) |>    arrange(desc(EDGE))  knitr::kable(EDGE2mult_summ)
